courseDescription:
Are you intrigued by the idea of building a website? This fascinating course provides all the fundamental skills necessary to create a professional website using HTML and CSS. You will explore HTML5, CSS3, Flexbox, building animations, working with navigations and integrating images directly into a website. We will take you through simple processes employed in building websites and explain how to build the structure of a website and the relevance of the cascading style sheet model in the overall website experience. Do you know that web layout is crucial during the development of a website? We will introduce you to Flexbox and you will learn how to use it with the animation and planning of the layout of a website.

Then the course describes the various methods used in building components in the navigation bar of a website and ‘padding’ during website development. Discover the importance of design thinking in website development and how to use it to produce a user-oriented website. Next, we will introduce you to the two most important items required when building a website: a browser and a text editor. Do you know that CSS plays a vital role in developing a website? This course goes into further detail by taking you through how CSS influences the structure of a website. Does the name ‘Cascading Style Sheet’ sound a little confusing to you? We will take you through an in-depth analysis of the Cascading Style Sheet (CSS) to help alleviate any confusion. Learn how to embed links in HTML and how they work together with navigation elements. Finally, master the ‘HTML DIV’ tags and the process required for HTML class I.D.s.

This course will illustrate how to build the navigation bar components. Do you know that ‘padding’ is a fundamental concept in CSS? We will take you through a short guide on using it in CSS. Margins are more or less the foundational aspect of CSS and we will discuss the use of margins in CSS. Did you know that fonts are essential to give your website a nice look and feel? We explain how to integrate custom fonts in CSS and outline refactoring CSS code for more specific selectors in HTML. Study the use of Flexbox inside the CSS grid container before implementing animation in HTML and CSS. Finally, you will learn the details behind CSS’s different navigation bar styles. This course has no technical prerequisite and is perfect for anyone looking to start building a professional website entirely from scratch. The ideal student for this course is dedicated and wants to learn how to build a modern technology website. Start this course today and kickstart your fantastic career in website development.
